page.title: 16BRUNSWICK TOWN
page.content: Brunswick Town was started in 1825 and was intended to be a self-supporting unit and includes St Andrew's Church, designed by Sir Charles Barry and the Market Building, both of which still stand. Brunswick Terrace and Square are matched only by the Regency Terraces of Bath. Due to social and economic change during the 20th century - smaller families, the decline in the employment of servants - meant such large houses, some of 5 storeys, were no longer viable. Most of the houses were converted for multiple occupation (many of the residents being retired)> Under the Town & Country Planning Act of 1947 Brunswick Town has been declared a Conservation area. A special Development Plan was updated in 1985.
